text: Pelé during the 1970 FIFA World Cup. Pelé is a retired Brazilian football player who represented the Brazil national football team as a striker from 1957 to 1971. He is widely considered to be the greatest football player of all time. He is currently the all-time top goalscorer for Brazil with 77 international goals, which he scored in 92 appearances. 12 of those goals came during his 14 World Cup appearances, including 4 goals in 1970. Pelé shares with Uwe Seeler, Miroslav Klose, and Cristiano Ronaldo, the achievement of being the only three footballers to have scored in four separate World Cup tournaments.https://www.realmadrid.com/en/news/2018/06/cristiano-ronaldo-has- scored-in-the-last-4-world-cups ==International goals == Pelé is the top scorer of the Brazil national football team with 77 goals in 92 official appearances.http://www.rsssf.com/miscellaneous/pele-intlg.html In addition, he scored 18 times in 22 unofficial games. This makes an unofficial total of 114 games and 95 goals. He also scored 12 goals and is credited with 10 assists in 14 World Cup appearances, including 4 goals and 7 assists in 1970.
